modules.description: Provides operations to control and query a media player via D-Bus, including quitting, raising, and checking support for URI schemes and MIME types. Works with OBus_proxy.t to access properties like fullscreen status, player identity, and desktop entry. Used to integrate with MPRIS-compliant players for remote control and feature detection.

This module offers control operations for media playback, including play, pause, stop, seek, and track navigation, alongside property management for attributes like playback status, volume, metadata, and loop settings, all interacting with D-Bus proxy objects. It enables applications to monitor and adjust playback behavior, such as modifying shuffle or repeat modes, and retrieve real-time data like current position or track details. Use cases include building media control interfaces or integrating playback management into desktop applications.

Provides functions to interact with media player playlists through D-Bus, including activating a specific playlist, retrieving playlist details with pagination, and monitoring playlist changes. Works with D-Bus proxies, strings, integers, and tuples containing playlist metadata. Used to manage dynamic playlist switching and track real-time updates in media applications.

Provides methods to quit and raise a media player, and properties to query player capabilities, identity, and supported formats. Works with OBus interface definitions and properties, including boolean flags, strings, and lists. Used to interact with MPRIS-compliant media players via D-Bus, enabling control and status checks.

This module offers control and status operations for media playback, including play, pause, seek, and metadata retrieval, while managing properties like playback rate, volume, and shuffle. It interacts with media player state and metadata, utilizing parameters such as URI, position, and rate to manipulate and monitor playback. Use cases include dynamic audio control, real-time status updates, and synchronization of playback actions across applications.

Provides methods to activate playlists, retrieve playlist lists with filters, and signals for playlist changes. Works with OBus_path.t, int32, string, and boolean types to interact with media player playlist data. Used to manage and monitor playlist state and content in MPRIS-compliant applications.

Provides functions for querying and controlling media players via the MPRIS DBUS interface, including play, pause, next, and previous track operations. Works with player-specific identifiers, track metadata, and playback state representations. Enables direct interaction with Banshee and Spotify through standardized DBUS method calls.

Combines D-Bus interaction to control and monitor media players, offering play, pause, seek, and track navigation along with property management for playback status, volume, and metadata. Enables checking player capabilities, managing playlists with pagination and real-time updates, and accessing properties like fullscreen status and desktop entry. Operations include querying URI and MIME support, adjusting loop and shuffle settings, and switching between playlists. Examples include building remote control interfaces, integrating playback management into desktop apps, and detecting player features dynamically.

combines control, status, and playlist management for MPRIS-compliant media players through D-Bus. It exposes operations to quit, raise, play, pause, seek, and retrieve metadata, along with properties like capabilities, volume, and shuffle. Playlist interactions include activating, listing, and monitoring changes using path identifiers, integers, and boolean flags. Users can control playback, query player state, and manage playlists dynamically across applications.
